frontmatter.title: EPL Tactical Review: City 2-1 United
frontmatter.description: A data-backed breakdown of how City controlled central zones and created higher quality shots.

sections.heading: Tactical Overview
paragraphs: City built through a narrow midfield box, keeping possession in central zones and forcing United into a compact 4-4-2 mid-block.
United relied on direct transitions, but their shot quality came mostly from low xG attempts outside the box.

figures.alt: Pass network for City showing a dense midfield cluster.
figures.caption: City pass network (successful passes only).

claims.claim: City sustained possession through central triangles that limited United pressing outlets.

sections.heading: Shot Selection
paragraphs: City generated six shots from inside the box, including the two goals, while United attempted three long-range efforts without a goal.
The shot map shows City concentrating attempts in the right half-space, aligning with their primary overload lane.

figures.alt: Shot map showing City attempts clustered inside the box.
figures.caption: Shot map with goal outcomes highlighted.

player_notes.summary: Dictated tempo with frequent progressive passes into the final third.
Led United's counters but lacked support in the box.
